TopicTitle: Rework Heat shield darkening - Ablator is black on launch when lowering slider.

Articles.Content:
When lowering ablator (useful for optimizing launch mass) the heatshield texture starts at launch almost pitch black:

![CMJKQS7.png](http://i.imgur.com/CMJKQS7.png)

Since Heatshield ablator effects part mass, I don't think this is a fairly uncommon thing to do. I'm not the biggest fan of the current effects in comparison. ![;.;](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cry.gif)

**Edited <time datetime="2015-06-23T09:28:37Z" title="06/23/2015 09:28  AM" data-short="9 yr">June 23, 2015</time> by Avera9eJoe**

I think this effect is meant to emulate the charring that a heatshield experiences as ablator is burned off. It looks a bit odd when ablator is tweaked out, but I don't think that is how heatshields are "meant" to be used. I say that as someone who uses them as insulators in stacks with the ablator tweaked out. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

> 
> I think this effect is meant to emulate the charring that a heatshield experiences as ablator is burned off. It looks a bit odd when ablator is tweaked out, but I don't think that is how heatshields are "meant" to be used. I say that as someone who uses them as insulators in stacks with the ablator tweaked out. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

It's supposed to emulate the ablator burned off but it does look pretty bad when starting at low ablator :/. After sitting on this over night, I'm thinking it would be nice if the effect was taken as a percentage of the ablator at launch. 

To explain better, at launch ablator would be at 100%, no matter where on the slider you put it. As it nears depletion (0%) it gradually changes to becoming completely black, rather than changing color based on where on the slider it is. I think that would be more realistic.

Using Heatshields as insulators? That sounds genius! XD I shall experiment...
